R

readDouble(int) - Method in class linefit.DataColumn
Reads the value from the row with the given index
readInSettingFromLine(String) - Method in class linefit.GraphArea
Reads in the graph settings from the passed String and stores it in its proper value
recursivelyGenerateLaTexExportString(StringBuilder) - Method in class linefit.GraphArea
Continues to recursively export to a LaTEx File.
recursivelyOpenLineFitFile(BufferedReader, boolean) - Method in class linefit.GraphArea
Continues the recursive open of a LineFit file into the current instance Note: this should not be used independently!
refreshAllSetsThirdColumn() - Method in class linefit.GraphArea
Makes sure all the dataset's third columns are updated so we can change whether we use only x errors of y errors This has to be done because the third column can be either x or y errors/uncertainties
refreshAxesPower() - Method in class linefit.GraphArea
Determines the power to use on the axes so that they stay small unless it is overridden by the user
refreshFitData() - Method in class linefit.DataSet
Recalculates the FitData with our current FitType and data
refreshFitData() - Method in class linefit.FitAlgorithms.LinearFitStrategy
Recalculates the Fit for the given DataSet - updates the fit for the given values
refreshLastColumn() - Method in class linefit.DataSet
Internal method used to update the last column in the DataSet being displayed
refreshThirdColumn() - Method in class linefit.DataSet
Makes sure the third column is updated so we can change whether we use only x errors of y errors This has to be done because the third column can be either x or y errors/uncertainties
registerDataSet(DataSet) - Method in class linefit.GraphArea
Registers the given data set to this graph area by placing it in the DataSet selector box at the end but before the New Data Set option
removeColumn() - Method in class linefit.DataSet
Makes the last visible column invisible so it is no longer displayed but the data is still kept in case we want it later
removeColumn(int) - Method in class linefit.DataSetTableModel
Removes the column with the given index from the table
removeLayoutComponent(Component) - Method in class linefit.GraphOptionsMenu.GraphOptionsFrameLayout
 
removeTransparencySlider(JColorChooser) - Static method in class linefit.CustomColorMenu
A function that removes the transparency slider from the JColorChooser taken from stack overflow question: http://stackoverflow.com/questions/12026767/java-7-jcolorchooser-disable-transparency-slider Post Author: user3455283
RESERVED_FOR_CUSTOM_COLOR - Static variable in class linefit.ColorBoxRenderer
Defines the color we are using as reserved for the custom color option
resetToDefaults() - Method in class linefit.GraphOptionsMenu
This function when called restores the default start up option for the graph options
resetToNew() - Method in class linefit.DataSet
Resets this DataSet to an empty one as if it had just been created
resultsAreDisplayedOnGraph - Variable in class linefit.GraphArea
Keeps track of if the results should be drawn on the graph itself
resultsDecimalPlaces - Variable in class linefit.GraphArea
The number of decimal places to use in the linear fit results
resultsInbetweenSpacing - Variable in class linefit.GraphArea
The spacing in pixels between the lines in the results when they are displayed on the graph
resultsPositionX - Variable in class linefit.GraphArea
The x position in pixels of the bottom right corner of the results from the bottom right corner of the square formed by the axes
resultsPositionY - Variable in class linefit.GraphArea
The y position in pixels of the bottom right corner of the results from the bottom right corner of the square formed by the axes
resultsUseScientificNotation - Variable in class linefit.GraphArea
Whether or not to use scientific notation for the linear fit's results
rightSideBar - Variable in class linefit.LineFit
The panel along the right side of the LineFit window that contains the current DataSet information as well as the linear fit's results if the current DataSet has a selected fit

Rounds a number (in string form) to a specified number of places, which is centered on the decimal place e.g.
